projects.title: Red Dungeon
projects.summary: A standard-deck print-and-play dungeon crawler where players rebel against cursed-mine guards in a compact card-driven system.

projects.promoDetails: Promoted as a launch notification page for early supporters.

projects.title: Almighty ⚡️ The Godliest God Game

projects.title: Logic & Lore 2nd Edition & Expansion
projects.summary: A revised edition and expansion bundle that adds more tactical cardplay and content to the Logic & Lore system, including a $10 print-and-play pledge tier.

projects.title: The Black Dahlia Case - Murder Mystery Game
projects.summary: A murder mystery game inspired by the Black Dahlia case with a $12 print-and-play basic pledge tier.

projects.title: Rolling Pirates
projects.summary: Treasure Hunt - An adventure roll-and-write game with free navigation in print-and-play format.

projects.title: Hidden Realms: The Mummy's Tomb
projects.summary: Hidden Realms: The Mummy's Tomb is a single-page, print-and-play, roll-and-write dungeon crawl inspired by classic D&D maps. Draw polyomino shapes to map a new dungeon every game. Uncover treasure in the form of coins, keys, and magic items. Face deadly guardians, like oozes, skeletons, zombies, golems, mimics, and the Mummy itself. Plan carefully, because defeating it is not for the faint of heart. Are you up for the challenge?
projects.promoDetails: Submitted as a preview crowdfunding project.

projects.title: Flipping Fortune
projects.summary: A quirky push-your-luck tarot card game with some deckbuilding. Print & Play.
projects.promoDetails: Submitted as a preview crowdfunding project.

projects.title: Bravery
projects.summary: A card-based survival game about surviving in the wilderness.
projects.promoDetails: Submitted as a preview crowdfunding project.

projects.title: BYTE: SHIFT
projects.summary: BYTE:SHIFT is a competitive hacking game where one or two players design the most effective routines by drafting modular elements onto their floppy disks.
projects.promoDetails: Submitted as a preview crowdfunding project.

designers.name: Martin Melbardis
designers.bio: Designer of wargames such as Campaign: Fall Blau, Rome Must Fall and Operation Barbarossa, Martin has been obsessed with history and solitaire games for as long as he can remember—probably longer. He’s spent years dreaming up wargames, much to the confusion of friends and family who prefer games with “fun” themes. When he’s not buried in research or fine-tuning dice mechanics, he’s either contemplating his next big design or wondering if he really needs another book on the Eastern Front (he does). With a passion for making quick-playing solo wargames that are both historically rich and mechanically engaging, Martin has created a small independent wargaming company called "Solo Wargame" with a single mission to ensure that no gamer ever has to suffer through an unbalanced AI opponent again.

designers.name: Martin van Rossum
designers.bio: Board game designer & escape room designer from the Netherlands.

designers.name: Raoul Schaupp
designers.bio: - Born in 1983 in Karlsruhe/Germany - Studied System Engineering and works as a Consultant in the field of Concept Development E/E-Systems

designers.name: Florian Fiedler
designers.bio: I'm a graphic designer and illustrator by profession, and a passionate creator with a love for games that offer high replayability, short to medium playtimes, and multiple strategic avenues to explore. My favorite games include Magic: The Gathering, Lost Ruins of Arnak, DotA, and Chess—all of which share that balance of depth and strategy that I admire.

designers.name: Jason Hager
designers.bio: Illustrator and game designer. Half of the game design duo of Durdle Games.

designers.name: Robin Metz
designers.bio: Indie board game designer from Germany. Creator of Rotation Rumble.

publishers.name: Time to Dice
publishers.bio: Sport simulations, tabletop games, print&play games.

publishers.name: Rolling Rhino Games
publishers.bio: At Rolling Rhino Games we create board games that can be printed and played at home. Printed in full sheets so no cutting or crafting is needed. These games offer an experience you would normally find in a bigger box, for a small price point. We want to make our games accessible to everyone. They are often light-medium weight, making them perfect as gateway games and also offer strategic depth for expert players. With global shipping being expensive and slow, we offer a cheap solution which also decreases the waiting time to receive your games. And ofcourse it's good for the environment to print at your own house instead shipping products all over the world. We hope our games bring joy and excitement to all tables.

publishers.name: Keepers of Fun
publishers.bio: At Keepers of Fun, we are dedicated to developing inclusive, accessible, and enjoyable gaming experiences for all. Our innovative approach reimagines the conventional production and distribution model by offering games in a fully digital format—allowing users to download, print, and play instantly. This digital-first strategy significantly reduces environmental impact by eliminating the need for physical manufacturing and global shipping. By shifting the "game factory" into the homes of our players, we promote sustainability and convenience without compromising on quality. Furthermore, as a company based in a developing economy, we are acutely aware of the financial barriers posed by international shipping and import costs—often increasing retail prices by a factor of three. Through our print-and-play model, we aim to make board games more economically accessible and environmentally responsible. Join us in redefining the way games are enjoyed—where fun, affordability, and sustainability meet.

publishers.name: Nuka Zombee Games
publishers.bio: Indie game studio based in Auckland, NZ

publishers.name: Little Rocket Games
publishers.bio: Little Rocket Games is an independent Italian publishing company that deals with the conception, development, production and distribution of board games, card games and librigame. We start from the ideation of the game (we change our mind at least a dozen times), we illustrate every part of it paying maximum attention to the artistic aspect of the product, until, after long days of testing, we create a definitive prototype. We follow the production in all its aspects, we choose the best game components on the Italian and European territory and we assemble the games directly in our warehouse. Finally, we take care of the distribution part of our products, bringing them directly to store shelves. We are able to create your ideas, so don't hesitate to contact us.

publishers.name: Two Acorns Games
publishers.bio: The main goal of Two Acorns Games is to create roll-and-write games in a print-and-play format that catch the eye and stand out with simplicity, while also containing significant depth. —description from the publisher

publishers.name: Weird Giraffe Games
publishers.bio: Weird Giraffe Games, based in Huntsville, Alabama, is a group of game designers dedicated to creating games that are easy to learn and play, but layered with strategy.

publishers.name: Beaverlicious Games
publishers.bio: Beaverlicious is an indie card and tabletop game studio based in Frankfurt, Germany. Run by a small team of two people and one clever cat, Beaverlicious focuses on creating extremely small, cartridge-format games that fit in your pocket.
